author: rabia7933
content:
Hey, Just have query.
I have been reading that for stateless clients, Verkle trees and polynomial commitments(e.g Kate scheme) is a solution proposed, But is there any update on aggregatable proofs with vector commitments?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> proof aggregation is also possible (different schemes)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> But the full verkle trie proofs are still not "aggregatable" in the strict sense because you need to always provide all the intermediate commitments. So the verkle proof scales linearly with the number of keys. However it is still much smaller than a Merkle proof

author: rabia7933
content: I was reading this paper Aggregatable Subvector Commitments for Stateless Cryptocurrencies(https://eprint.iacr.org/2020/527.pdf). Is this still aligned with the current roadmap for stateless clients?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> We are not planning to use it. The problem is that the verifier needs to do a linear number of pairings, which are expensive
